Stuart MacGill to retire from international cricket after second Test against West Indies.

Riots began after Hindu leader Laxmananda Saraswati was killed on August 23.
5d221c86fdadca378eeaabc39c881cc74efcff07:
Bill Clinton called Vanity Fair reporter Todd Purdum a "scumbag" and "sleazy" over an article.
The article suggested Clinton's personality changed after his 2004 heart bypass surgery.
Hillary Clinton's campaign apologized for Bill's "inappropriate" language used in response.
The article quoted anonymous former Clinton aides and sparked a heated debate.
7a49f5bc1d336309f57076bceba91885ee5368b5:
Prince William starts a two-month attachment with the Royal Navy on Monday.
He will train in sea survival, firefighting, and ship damage repair.
If he passes, he will join the HMS Iron Duke in the Caribbean.
He will serve as Sub Lieutenant Wales during the attachment.
dd46893fd318dce4e209f9a335612659ebf8fd24:
Parma signs 18-year-old Alberto Paloschi in a co-ownership deal from AC Milan.
Paloschi scored with his first touch in his Milan debut in February.
Milan's Massimo Oddo may leave for Lyon, who already have Italian left-back Fabio Grosso.
acda8749fba5e9553e9f47cef89ef85eae5ad4e3:
JetBlue flight from Boston to Fort Lauderdale diverted due to in-flight fight.
Fight broke out after someone was smoking in the bathroom, injuring one person.
One passenger taken into custody at Raleigh-Durham International Airport in North Carolina.
Three people involved in the fight, believed to be related, caused a two-hour delay.
20b11518df6520f552d691d5f6c0d02755d11809:
US soldier accused of killing fellow soldiers in Iraq.
Two US soldiers, Staff Sgt. Darris Dawson and Sgt. Wesley Durbin, were shot and killed on a base.
Dawson's family says the military hasn't provided details on his death.
Death classified as "non-hostile" amid criticism of military's casualty reporting.
51fe083191bb5568bf6a5fea1610a8e19663d7b2:
New York Gov. David Paterson directs state agencies to recognize same-sex marriages performed elsewhere.
The directive follows a February court ruling that such marriages are entitled to recognition in New York.
The move aims to ensure state agencies comply with New York's human rights law.
The change affects marriages performed in California, Massachusetts, Canada, and other countries.
8af047c2d83a91e8b745adfcaa7c282dfe1030a2:
Residents of Galveston, Texas, return to find homes and businesses destroyed by Hurricane Ike.
Many evacuees are struggling to rebuild their lives in shelters and temporary housing.
Power outages and flooding continue to affect communities in Texas, Ohio, and other states.
Families are coping with loss and displacement, with some deciding to start anew in different cities.
dfcacd955a9168b2cf599c57a539dbfce43ea2a9:
Susana Trimarco's daughter Marita Veron vanished in Argentina, suspected victim of human trafficking and prostitution.
Trimarco has spent 6½ years searching for her, facing danger and gaining recognition worldwide.
Her story inspired a popular Argentine soap opera, "Stolen Lives," which exposes human trafficking issues.
The show and Trimarco's efforts have led to rescued victims and a new law against human trafficking.
f2463954bc7215d8a1f98cf0d85f280fd2affa58:
A 6.1 magnitude earthquake struck southern Iceland on Thursday.
Injuries and material damage reported, with roads and buildings affected.
The epicenter was near Reykjavik, with the quake felt nationwide.
No fatalities reported, but 15-20 people taken for medical treatment.
0e7a92a6f06e94cdd613860d4a3f4b92a06a2b43:
US sailor shoots and kills two female sailors at Bahrain barracks.
The shooter, a male, survives self-inflicted gunshot and is in critical condition.
The incident is not terror-related and involves only US military personnel.
The motive for the shootings remains unclear.
2905a15c5947042e42f4b52dc201d24822af20f1:
Over 100 countries adopt treaty to ban cluster bombs at Dublin conference.
The treaty prohibits use, development, and transfer of cluster munitions.
Countries must destroy stockpiles within eight years and clean up contaminated areas.
The ban aims to end 40 years of suffering from cluster bomb injuries.
808a3d788317af05686ee71a71d2fbc5c19267bc:
Indonesia to withdraw from OPEC due to declining oil production levels.
The country has become a net importer of oil, joining few others.
Indonesia's decision may not impact global oil prices significantly.
It is the only southeast Asian country in the 13-nation oil cartel.
5a1bec30205b6938392f3119366e27d15b4849e8:
Rear Adm. John Stufflebeem had an affair with a federal employee in the White House in 1990.
He falsely told her he was a widower and lied about the affair to investigators.
Stufflebeem was demoted, fired, and convicted of making false official statements.
He requested retirement after an admiral's mast hearing.
7ff39e1220c0f084434786ed145e15c6abe48def:
Two U.S. customs agents arrested for helping smuggle drugs and contraband through JFK Airport.
They solicited and accepted bribes to allow undetected passage of illegal goods.
The agents face narcotics, bribery, and conspiracy charges.
The investigation led to over 20 indictments and 600 pounds of seized drugs.
7551503e7e57bd519913b0df90ca1e80d5305b05:
Guatemala halts foreign adoptions amid reports of coercion and baby-selling.
Vietnam also stopped adoptions to the US due to corruption and baby-selling accusations.
About 2,000 US families are affected by Guatemala's case-by-case review of pending adoptions.
Adoptions from Guatemala and Vietnam have been halted indefinitely.
c34a0cbf6db61323766fc86b1b89b399ff6b0666:
Three men re-arrested in connection with Natalee Holloway's 2005 disappearance in Aruba.
New evidence led to the arrests of Joran Van der Sloot and brothers Deepak and Satish Kalpoe.
The men were previously arrested but released due to insufficient evidence.
They are charged with involvement in Holloway's manslaughter or causing her death.
d07a61368a195444b14bd4b382e0fc3d64890b22:
Founder of Free Burma Coalition criticizes China and India for not aiding Myanmar cyclone victims.
He also slams ASEAN for not pressuring Myanmar junta to allow international aid workers.
Myanmar's military rulers are accused of prioritizing their security and political ambitions over cyclone victims.
The official death toll from Cyclone Nargis has risen to over 40,000.
aa68dee4bc246e5aae9507342f8520a2a301a310:
Xenophobic violence spreads from Johannesburg to Cape Town, South Africa.
One death and 15 arrests reported in Cape Town clashes overnight.
Over 40 deaths reported in Johannesburg, thousands displaced and seeking refuge.
Mozambique declares state of emergency as 10,000 flee South Africa.
87ef15064035db73cb29f5cec2f0442f2c527ef0:
Former Illinois Gov. George Ryan and co-defendant Larry Warner lose Supreme Court appeal.
They were convicted of federal racketeering and fraud in 2006.
Ryan is serving a 6½-year sentence in a Wisconsin federal prison.
The convictions stem from bribes paid for state licenses during Ryan's governorship.
a577b934e210ef7dce07390711f03db8bb2e005a:
Nigeria's rebel group MEND claims to have sabotaged an oil pipeline in Rivers State.
The group says it killed 11 government soldiers in fighting that followed the attack.
The military denies the claim, calling it "pure propaganda."
MEND seeks a greater share of oil wealth for Niger Delta residents.
c9414bf55859cb9ca7e925a4a09b416b6f66446a:
Top authors share their favorite summer reads, from one-day books to long-weekend novels.
Some recommended books include classics like "The Great Gatsby" and "The Godfather".
Authors suggest reading Tennessee Williams, Flannery O'Connor, and Jane Austen for a literary summer.
Short stories and poetry collections are also great for dipping into and out of.
f12cda150b96acfa1499b2afb0a81029545abadf:
Robert Reich, former Clinton Labor Secretary, endorses Barack Obama for president.
Reich praises Obama's policy proposals, citing better chances of success.
Former Sens. Sam Nunn and David Boren also endorse Obama's White House bid.
Endorsements come ahead of Pennsylvania's April 22 primary with 158 delegates at stake.
7359741b0e60b4402f069963a26c7aa766f45e7c:
Researchers reprogrammed human skin cells to act like embryonic stem cells, a potential breakthrough in curing disease.
The new research shows alternatives to embryonic stem cells are available, vindicating President Bush's policies.
Bush has twice vetoed bills easing limits on funding for embryonic stem cell research due to ethical concerns.
The breakthrough may steer stem cell research in a more explicitly ethical direction.
b10c71f49dbeabad23325d625e8e7b8529429607:
Josef Fritzl, 73, confessed to imprisoning his daughter for 24 years and fathering seven of her children.
He twice vacationed in Thailand while his daughter remained trapped in a cellar below his house.
Fritzl's daughter and some of her children were reunited with her mother and other children on Sunday.
The family will face a long period of adjustment after being freed from captivity.
c5a1e04f5f84d406ffedfc2f312c314d1bc03c46:
Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah vows to cooperate in Lebanon's political life.
Nasrallah seeks national partnership with no control or imposition of ideas.
Lebanon's parliament elects Michel Sleiman as president after six-month vacancy.
Sleiman's election brings hope for a new era and national unity in Lebanon.
8a5035d3527c4db4357dd1db9fb2712008dccea9:
A Texas appeals court ruled that the state had no right to remove hundreds of FLDS children.
The children were taken due to suspicion of sexual abuse on the sect's ranch in Eldorado.
The children are likely to be returned to their parents, a CNN legal analyst says.
Their parents claim the children are "hurting very badly" and "feel betrayed by adults."
3f33d4cb25cd121619ba99eeb02709b72716d622:
Consumer Reports analyzed 300 car models to determine the cost of ownership.
A cheaper sticker price doesn't always mean lower costs in the long run.
Depreciation and fuel costs account for 69% of total ownership costs.
Cheaper cars like Mitsubishi Lancer can cost more to own than pricier models.
e6f451d6667f142a64818a9d05dbc49115e7cbf9:
Roland Martin discusses the elitist label applied to presidential candidates.
The candidates' educational backgrounds and wealth are scrutinized.
Their privileged lives contradict the "regular folks" narrative.
Elitism exists in both parties, not just among Democrats.
39622c01625247af942a6439699ff529db1d54d0:
Carmen Salva started Esperanza de Vida to educate youth about environmental conservation in Argentina.
The group cleans up trash in the mountains, collecting 60 bags of recyclables on an average Saturday.
Students and teachers work together, with help from "eco-llamas" that carry the heavy load.
The program aims to instill environmental respect in a new generation.
02927c88776bcc84fc883435a5037b4c8ca70e83:
The US has seen 64 measles cases this year, the most in seven years.
Most cases were in unvaccinated individuals, with 54 cases imported from other countries.
Cases were reported in nine states, with patients ranging from 5 months to 71 years old.
No deaths were reported, but 14 patients were hospitalized.
3ee31d8987c07ba4ea9423d39c5e333525316958:
Amnesty International releases annual report on human rights worldwide, criticizing China, US, and Russia.
The report highlights issues in Darfur, Zimbabwe, Gaza, Iraq, and Myanmar, demanding immediate attention.
At least 81 countries torture or mistreat people, and 77 countries restrict free expression.
Amnesty urges US to close Guantanamo Bay detention camp and reject torture.
f8ddc6d36f378757d27a244529f8fe11672baa41:
A judge declares a mistrial in the retrial of six men accused of plotting with al Qaeda.
The alleged ringleader testifies he wasn't serious about his terrorism threats.
This is the second mistrial in the case against the "Liberty City 7".
The government may pursue a third trial against the defendants.
4e97228ceef1be54ab9151fc6759017e6a54a18d:
US Customs agent Luis Aguilar, 32, killed by suspected narcotics smuggler's car.
Incident occurred in Imperial Sand Dunes Recreation Area near California-Arizona border.
Aguilar was trying to stop two vehicles believed to have entered country illegally.
Authorities working with Mexico to apprehend suspects.
0e649ccabaf0e650e9757ee256c2749d37486ba6:
Rozita Swinton, 33, is a person of interest in the Texas polygamist ranch raid case.
She made phone calls to a crisis center hotline in 2008, authorities said.
Swinton has been arrested in Colorado on unrelated charges of false reporting.
The Texas raid removed 416 children from the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints ranch.
9eccfcc231c7c0d65cb0c333cb3d1731a5fe2f3f:
Denzel Washington credits the Boys & Girls Club with changing his life's direction as a child.
Nearly 30% of this year's high school freshmen are expected to drop out.
The youth crisis includes rising obesity, violent crime, poverty, and teenage pregnancy rates.
Denzel urges Americans to advocate for youth policies and support organizations like Boys & Girls Clubs.
ddf109b3de6022a4ecd62ee2cd31d2c2ac51035b:
Thousands protested China's human rights record in San Francisco as the Olympic flame arrived.
Protesters chanted and waved flags outside the Chinese consulate, calling for an end to killings.
The Olympic flame relay continues despite disruptions in London and Paris.
Some IOC members suggest ending the global torch relay early due to ongoing protests.
bd92eab23374d95ac4430e2e1a8bf7561c662309:
Jockey Frankie Dettori and chef Marco Pierre White opened restaurants together, starting with one in London in 2004.
The duo now has six restaurants worldwide, and recently released a cookbook, "Frankie Dettori's Italian Family Cookbook".
The cookbook features a favorite family recipe, Aubergine Parmigiana, a vegetarian dish with a meaty texture.
The dish reminds Dettori of his childhood Sunday lunches with his family.
d84440effc748f9220c7dde068962e803f566bc7:
Middlesbrough release midfielders Fabio Rochemback and Gaizka Mendieta, and striker Dong Gook Lee.
Middlesbrough manager Gareth Southgate hopes to keep goalkeeper Mark Schwarzer with a new contract.
Tottenham's Jamie O'Hara signs a new three-year contract, while Radek Cerny leaves the club.
Rivaldo changes mind, will play for Greek club AEK next season.
e2866f596c85b0191ce812260d23855c70a01192:
Birmingham City's co-owner and managing director were interviewed by police in a corruption probe.
The investigation focuses on payments to a football agent and two players from 2002-03.
No allegations were made against the club or its directors benefiting financially.
The club is cooperating fully with the police investigation.
4ebd9195bc8c12272b6281a5a610a7b5fb49b8cd:
A rancher's 1996 photo is believed to be the first of a live jaguar in the United States.
Jaguars, an endangered species, have been spotted in Arizona, sparking conservation concerns.
A border fence may block jaguars' movement, threatening their survival in the US.
Conservationists worry about the fence's impact on wildlife and the jaguar's habitat.
4bd37aa7004cd1fdf1ccb506d2159a2cf26995e0:
Sudan and Chad sign non-aggression agreement to halt cross-border hostilities.
The agreement aims to normalize relations and stop support for rebel groups.
The UN will monitor the deal to prevent renewed violence.
The agreement was facilitated by Senegal's President Abdoulaye Wade.
29b87dc549b8c64b35517e684e79b1da6316bd88:
Viktor Bout, an international arms dealer, is charged with conspiring to sell weapons to a Colombian rebel group.
The weapons were intended to be used to kill Americans in Colombia, federal prosecutors announced.
Bout faces four terrorism offenses, including conspiracy to kill US nationals and providing support to terrorists.
The US seeks Bout's extradition from Thailand, where he is currently in custody.
d2f2fe0b8797b416bae71305c9d1c874e2fdd0cc:
Hillary Clinton's chief strategist Mark Penn is quitting amid criticism of his firm's Colombian government contacts.
Penn's firm had met with Colombia's ambassador to discuss a pending US-Colombia free-trade deal.
Clinton will keep Penn as an adviser, but not as chief strategist.
Penn's meeting was called "an error in judgment" and sparked Colombia to fire his PR firm.
0269d39abbea3edadd225fa97d818f5a789b4c72:
Thousands protested China's human rights record in San Francisco as the Olympic flame arrived.
Protesters chanted and waved flags outside the Chinese consulate, holding signs.
The protests followed similar demonstrations in London and Paris, with dozens arrested.
The Olympic flame relay continues Wednesday in San Francisco despite the protests.
394f20c9bee9bc8d0e6a65bac48de57bd9f4733d:
Skybus Airlines is shutting down passenger flights due to rising fuel costs and economic issues.
The Ohio-based airline is the third to cease operations this week, following ATA and Aloha.
Skybus will cease operations effective Saturday, with flights on Friday to be completed as scheduled.
Passengers with future reservations are advised to seek refunds from their credit card companies.
6e63c8b1ae01ab91b4832222edaf4bb461b6c568:
A U.S. sailor was arrested for murdering a Japanese taxi driver in Yokosuka.
The sailor, Olatunbosun Ogbogu, was handed over to authorities by the U.S. military.
The incident sparked renewed controversy over the U.S. military presence in Japan.
The U.S. ambassador to Japan vowed that justice would be served in the case.
355875856932fd634aaf7c6b26155403aaf15904:
Keanu Reeves stars as Tom Ludlow, a tough, rule-breaking LAPD detective in "Street Kings."
The film follows Ludlow's struggle with a corrupt world and his own demons.
Reeves' performance is clean and spare, fitting the movie's gritty, Cop Noir style.
The story, though familiar, explores the pitfalls of a "necessary evil" in law enforcement.
999523913d281ab57977d79b644f3879ac4d2e37:
Texas authorities investigate child safety at polygamist sect leader Warren Jeffs' 400-member ranch.
The 1,900-acre ranch is sealed off with police escorting social workers inside.
The investigation follows a referral, but no safety issues have been determined yet.
The sect, led by convicted felon Warren Jeffs, practices polygamy and has 10,000 members.
5f7424604ec11358dc6fdfa47732f90422949041:
Mikhail Gorbachev says Georgia provoked conflict in South Ossetia.
Gorbachev blames Georgia for "barbaric assault" on Tskhinvali city.
Georgian President Saakashvili disputes Gorbachev's claims as "lies".
Gorbachev also criticizes US for backing Georgia.
fdb2b65b9cb99b7d52559ae647cae293cb5910d3:
At least 19 schoolgirls died in a dormitory fire west of Kampala, Uganda.
Two adults also died in the blaze at Buddo Junior School.
The cause of the fire is under investigation by police.
The incident occurred about 60 kilometers west of Kampala.
f974fe1b3777ffc5756322c0bb3f31a9b23ec09a:
US suspects Pakistan's spy service aided Taliban in Afghan embassy bombing.
Pakistan denies allegations, calls them "unfounded and malicious".
Bombing killed 58 people, including Indian defense attache, on July 7.
US presented evidence to Pakistani officials, who reject claims as false.
2930e1a7ac24bce649bfbf5f5971e74515e38a0a:
Gloria Taylor, mother of murdered schoolboy Damilola Taylor, dies of suspected heart attack in London.
Gloria was 57 and had been walking with her husband when she collapsed.
Damilola was stabbed and bled to death in 2000 at age 10 on way home from school.
Her son's killing prompted widespread soul-searching and led to establishment of Damilola Taylor Trust.
f5f7571a69e96c1d288d939861b7216c2bdc0ae4:
Pope Benedict XVI arrives in the US for a six-day visit to Washington and New York.
He was greeted by President Bush and will address the UN General Assembly on Friday.
The pope will meet with US cardinals and bishops, and address the sex scandal in the Catholic Church.
Security is tight, with 27 agencies and the Coast Guard involved in protecting the pontiff.
5f02aa32bd1dc95e47355755398e31550b232f8a:
Eight Florida teens, six girls, face life in prison for videotaped beating of 16-year-old.
They allegedly retaliated for online insults, planning to post video on YouTube.
The victim suffers from blurred vision, hearing loss, and a swollen face.
Teens are to be tried as adults, with first court appearance scheduled.
9177e5ac94f038749e8d4eb526a65461e0f6df4c:
Judge Bennett ruled in favor of Paul McCartney in his divorce from Heather Mills.
Heather Mills' claims of being wealthy before meeting McCartney were deemed exaggerated.
McCartney's wealth was estimated to be around $800 million, not $1.6 billion as claimed by Mills.
The judge found Mills' attitude to be a case of "me, too," seeking to maintain her lavish lifestyle.
f12e4bbb07211de7d43b4e331dc73404aa804562:
Sarah Knox Taylor Davis was the first wife of Confederate President Jefferson Davis and died of malaria at 21.
Elizabeth Harrison Walker was a lawyer, journalist, and TV personality who lived through the Gilded and Television Ages.
Margaret Woodrow Wilson was a singer who performed for Allied troops in World War I and later moved to India.
Elizabeth Ann Christian Blaesing was the daughter of President Warren Harding and his mistress Nan Britton.
Margaret Truman Daniel was a singer and author who was
